Tarnished's Furled Finger.name: Tarnished's Furled Finger
Tarnished's Furled Finger.summary: Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer.
Arrive as a cooperator (Furled Finger) with the objective of defeating the area boss of the world to which you were summoned.
A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook.
It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

Duelist's Furled Finger.name: Duelist's Furled Finger
Duelist's Furled Finger.summary: Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer.
Arrive as an adversary (Duelist) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook.
The bronze adornments are the mark of a duelist.

Bloody Finger.name: Bloody Finger
Bloody Finger.summary: Attempts invasion of other player's world
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Attempts an invasion of another player's world.
If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world.
Glistening blood has been siphoned into the nail of this finger. Its sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.

Finger Severer.name: Finger Severer
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Use as a Host of Fingers to select a summoned player and send them back to their world.
Use when you have been summoned to another player's world to return to your own world.
This phantom blade severs the link formed by a Furled Finger, but the maidens scorn those who abuse its use.

White Cipher Ring.name: White Cipher Ring
White Cipher Ring.summary: When invaded, requests the aid of a hunter
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (Summoning is not always possible.)
One of the lost mystic codes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.

Blue Cipher Ring.name: Blue Cipher Ring
Blue Cipher Ring.summary: Answers requests for summoning from hunters
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter.
During hunter multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the invader of the summoned world.

Tarnished's Wizened Finger.name: Tarnished's Wizened Finger
Tarnished's Wizened Finger.summary: Used to write messages to other worlds
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Messages menu.)
Use to write messages. Your messages will be conveyed to other worlds, allowing other players to read them.
A finger of corpse wax, so emaciated the bone is visible.
It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

Phantom Bloody Finger.name: Phantom Bloody Finger
Phantom Bloody Finger.summary: Attempts repeat invasion of last targeted world
description: Item for online play.
Obtained after invading another world.
Consumed upon use.
Attempts another invasion of the most recently invaded world.
This may come in handy should separation from the Host of Fingers force a temporary retreat.

Taunter's Tongue.name: Taunter's Tongue
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion.
Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)

Small Golden Effigy.name: Small Golden Effigy
Small Golden Effigy.summary: Sends a co-op summoning sign to summoning pools
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Send a cooperative summon sign to several summoning pools (activated pools only).
In cooperative multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned.

Small Red Effigy.name: Small Red Effigy
Small Red Effigy.summary: Sends a hostile summoning sign to summoning pools
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Send a competitive summon sign to several summoning pools (activated pools only).
In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.

Festering Bloody Finger.name: Festering Bloody Finger
Festering Bloody Finger.summary: Attempts invasion of other player's world
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Consumed upon use.
Attempts an invasion of another player's world.
If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world.
This furled finger is blackened with blood congestion. It seems to have been chopped off rather unceremoniously.

Recusant Finger.name: Recusant Finger
Recusant Finger.summary: Attempts invasion of other player's world
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Attempts an invasion of another player's world.
If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Recusant) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world.
This furled finger is covered in snake scales.
An heirloom of the lord of the Volcano Manor, bequeathed to Tarnished who have become family.

Phantom Recusant Finger.name: Phantom Recusant Finger
Phantom Recusant Finger.summary: Attempts repeat invasion of last targeted world
description: Item for online play.
Obtained after invading another world.
Consumed upon use.
Attempts another invasion of the most recently invaded world.
This may come in handy should separation from the Host of Fingers force a temporary retreat.

Memory of Grace.name: Memory of Grace
Memory of Grace.summary: Lose all runes, return to last site of lost grace visited
description: The memory of first grace, which once guided bygone Tarnished to the Lands Between.
Lose all runes and return to last site of grace visited.
It is merely a cycle.
Stand before the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.

Spectral Steed Whistle.name: Spectral Steed Whistle
Spectral Steed Whistle.summary: Summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed
description: A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle.
Sound the whistle to summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed.
(Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.)
Upon his death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so drains the Flask of Crimson Tears.

Phantom Great Rune.name: Phantom Great Rune
Phantom Great Rune.summary: Give blessing of blood to enemies in invaded world
description: Item for online play.
Obtained after using the Mohg's Great Rune and invading another world.
Consumed upon use.
Enemies inside the invaded world receive a blessing of blood, which boosts their attack power when blood loss occurs nearby. Also, your HP recovers when blessed enemies defeat a player.

Furlcalling Finger Remedy.name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
Furlcalling Finger Remedy.summary: Reveals co-op and hostile summoning signs
description: Item for online play.
(Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.)
Craftable item.
Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs.
Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red.
Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.

Rune Arc.name: Rune Arc
Rune Arc.summary: Grants the blessing of an equipped Great Rune upon use
description: A shard of the shattered Elden Ring.
Grants the blessing of an equipped Great Rune upon use.
Even if no Great Rune is equipped, it will slightly increase maximum HP upon use.
The lower arc of the Elden Ring is held to be the basin in which its blessings pool. Perhaps this shard originates from that very arc.

Godrick's Great Rune.name: Godrick's Great Rune
description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Godrick.
Its blessing raises all attributes.
This Great Rune is known as the anchor ring, found in the center of the Elden Ring.
The first demigods were The Elden Lord Godfrey and his offspring, the golden lineage.

Radahn's Great Rune.name: Radahn's Great Rune
Radahn's Great Rune.summary: Raises maximum HP, FP and stamina
description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Radahn.
Its blessing raises maximum HP, FP and Stamina.
Radahn was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika.
The Great Rune burns, to resist the encroachment of the scarlet rot.

Morgott's Great Rune.name: Morgott's Great Rune
description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Morgott.
Its blessing greatly raises maximum HP.
This Great Rune is the anchor ring that houses the base, and proves two things:
That the Omen King was born of the golden lineage, and that he was indeed the Lord of Leyndell.

Rykard's Great Rune.name: Rykard's Great Rune
description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Rykard.
Its blessing restores HP upon defeating enemies.
Rykard was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika.
But Rykard fed himself to the blasphemous serpent, Great Rune and all.

Mohg's Great Rune.name: Mohg's Great Rune
Mohg's Great Rune.summary: Grants a blessing of blood to phantoms
description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg.
Its blessing grants a blessing of blood to summoned phantoms, and imparts a Phantom Great Rune upon successful invasion.
Mohg and Morgott are twin brothers, and their Great Runes are naturally similar.
But Mohg's rune is soaked in accursed blood, from his devout love for the wretched mire that he was born into far below the earth.

Malenia's Great Rune.name: Malenia's Great Rune
Malenia's Great Rune.summary: Attacks recover HP after damage is taken
description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia.
The blessing of this half-rotted rune reduces the healing power of Flask of Crimson Tears.
And yet, due to the infusion of Malenia's spirit of resistance, attacks made immediately after receiving damage will partially recover HP.
Malenia is daughter to Queen Marika and Radagon, and her Great Rune should have been the most sacred of all.

Fire Pot.name: Fire Pot
Fire Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict fire damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of incendiary materials is sealed inside.
Throw at enemies to inflict fire damage.

Redmane Fire Pot.name: Redmane Fire Pot
Redmane Fire Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Engraved with the crest of red-maned lion.
Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage.
Even today, the survivors of Radahn's battalion employ fire to stave off the scarlet rot.

Giantsflame Fire Pot.name: Giantsflame Fire Pot
Giantsflame Fire Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted by incantations of the Giants' Flame.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage.
Damage scales with faith.

Lightning Pot.name: Lightning Pot
Lightning Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict lightning damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of fulminating materials is sealed inside.
Throw at enemies to inflict lightning damage.

Ancient Dragonbolt Pot.name: Ancient Dragonbolt Pot
Ancient Dragonbolt Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict heavy lightning damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Engraved with the crest of the ancient dragon.
Throw at enemies to inflict heavy lightning damage.
Allows one to wield ancient drake lightning regardless of faith. The residual power of relics is a purely natural phenomenon.

Fetid Pot.name: Fetid Pot
Fetid Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe.
Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison.
Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies.
Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.

Swarm Pot.name: Swarm Pot
Swarm Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to release a swarm of flies
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside.
Throw at enemies to set a swarm of bloodflies upon them. The vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss. The cacophony of their wings assails the sanity of berserkers.
The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.

Holy Water Pot.name: Holy Water Pot
Holy Water Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage.
Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again.
The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.

Sacred Order Pot.name: Sacred Order Pot
Sacred Order Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage.
Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again.
The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.

Freezing Pot.name: Freezing Pot
Freezing Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Engraved with the crest of the Carian Royals.
Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost.
Originates from the cold, dark moon of Ranni, the Carian princess.

Poison Pot.name: Poison Pot
Poison Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside.
Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.

Oil Pot.name: Oil Pot
Oil Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to soak them in oil
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside.
Throw at enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.

Alluring Pot.name: Alluring Pot
Alluring Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw to lure foes of human build only.
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted with assassin incantations.
Consumes FP. Throw to create a pale shadow.
The illusion will lure in and distract foes of human build outside of combat, while demi-humans will be lured in even during combat.

Beastlure Pot.name: Beastlure Pot
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted with assassin incantations.
Consumes FP. Throw to create a red shadow.
The illusion lures in beasts into attacking it.
This effect does not change even during combat.

Roped Fire Pot.name: Roped Fire Pot
Roped Fire Pot.summary: Throw behind to inflict fire damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of incendiary materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Throw at rearward enemies to inflict fire damage.

Roped Lightning Pot.name: Roped Lightning Pot
Roped Lightning Pot.summary: Throw behind to inflict lightning damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of fulminating materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Throw at rearward enemies to inflict lightning damage.

Roped Fetid Pot.name: Roped Fetid Pot
Roped Fetid Pot.summary: Throw behind to cause buildup of deadly poison
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison.
Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies.
Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.

Roped Poison Pot.name: Roped Poison Pot
Roped Poison Pot.summary: Throw behind to cause buildup of poison
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of poison.

Roped Oil Pot.name: Roped Oil Pot
Roped Oil Pot.summary: Throw behind to douse enemies in oil
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Throw at rearward enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.

Roped Magic Pot.name: Roped Magic Pot
Roped Magic Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw behind to inflict magic damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of magically resonant materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Consumes FP. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict magic damage.

Roped Fly Pot.name: Roped Fly Pot
Roped Fly Pot.summary: Throw behind to release a swarm of flies
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Throw at rearward enemies to release a swarm of flies. Their fangs inflict countless painful lacerations on the victim while the grating sound of their wings assails their sanity.
The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.

Roped Volcano Pot.name: Roped Volcano Pot
Roped Volcano Pot.summary: Creates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
Powdered volcanic rock is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Thrown at rearward enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.

Roped Holy Water Pot.name: Roped Holy Water Pot
Roped Holy Water Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw behind to inflict holy damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Consumes FP. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict holy damage.
Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again.
The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.

Volcano Pot.name: Volcano Pot
Volcano Pot.summary: Creates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
Powdered volcanic rock is sealed inside.
Throw at enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.

Albinauric Pot.name: Albinauric Pot
Albinauric Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw to impede healing using a flask of tears.
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted by sorceries of the Cuckoos.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to impede recovery actions using a flask of tears for a certain duration.
The Knights of the Cuckoos do declare. Behold, thy defiled blood. Unlike any humor that flows in our grand realm.

Cursed-Blood Pot.name: Cursed-Blood Pot
Cursed-Blood Pot.summary: Throw to douse enemy with accursed blood
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Decorated with the crest of the Lord of Blood.
Throw at enemies to douse them in accursed blood, causing summoned spirits to assail them with a rabid fervor.
A childhood memory of the Lord of Blood.

Sleep Pot.name: Sleep Pot
Sleep Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw to cause buildup of sleep.
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
Enchanted by the incantations of St. Trina.
Consumes FP. Throw enemies to cause buildup of sleep.
Like a lullaby, or a quagmire, its light-purple haze irresistibly draws its victims down into sleep. Sweet dreams.

Rancor Pot.name: Rancor Pot
Rancor Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw to spawn vengeful spirits.
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
Enchanted by the ancient death hex.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits that chase down foes.
In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.

Magic Pot.name: Magic Pot
Magic Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw to inflict magic damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of magically resonant materials is sealed inside. Called a "faux sorcery" in Raya Lucaria.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict magic damage.

Academy Magic Pot.name: Academy Magic Pot
Academy Magic Pot.summary: Uses FP. Throw to inflict heavy magic damage.
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted by Raya Lucaria sorceries.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy magic damage.
This pot, considered a "faux sorcery," was employed to protect the academy.

Rot Pot.name: Rot Pot
Rot Pot.summary: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot
description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Decorated with the crest of scarlet wings.
Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot.
The rot bubbles up from the Swamp of Aeonia, and eats away at life like a vicious plague.

Rowa Raisin.name: Rowa Raisin
Rowa Raisin.summary: On horseback, feed to Torrent to restore HP
description: Preparation of dried Rowa fruit.
Craftable item.
Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to restore his HP.
Humans are unable to digest Rowa fruit, but Torrent seems to have a taste for it.

Sweet Raisin.name: Sweet Raisin
Sweet Raisin.summary: On horseback, feed to Torrent to greatly restore HP
description: Preparation of dried Golden Rowa fruit.
Craftable item.
Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to greatly restore his HP.
Golden Rowa fruit is not unlike honey, and Torrent seems to have a taste for it.

Frozen Raisin.name: Frozen Raisin
Frozen Raisin.summary: On horseback, feed to Torrent to vastly restore HP
description: Preparation of dried Rimed Rowa.
Craftable item.
Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to vastly restore his HP.
Torrent seems to enjoy the sensation of chewing this frozen, dried seed.

Boiled Crab.name: Boiled Crab
Boiled Crab.summary: Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a time
description: Boiled crab meat.
A prime specimen of plump and moist meat.
True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting.
Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration.
Unlike the "prawn" sold, this truly is crab. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.

Boiled Prawn.name: Boiled Prawn
Boiled Prawn.summary: Boosts physical damage negation for a time
description: Boiled prawn meat.
A prime specimen of plump and moist meat.
True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting.
Boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration.
The meat actually looks to have come from a crayfish. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.

Neutralizing Boluses.name: Neutralizing Boluses
Neutralizing Boluses.summary: Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison
description: Green boluses made from cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment.
Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.

Stanching Boluses.name: Stanching Boluses
description: Red boluses made from cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates impending blood loss.
Blood loss escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

Thawfrost Boluses.name: Thawfrost Boluses
description: Ice-hued boluses made from cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates buildup of frost and cures frostbite ailment.
Frost accumulates gradually, causing damage and inflicting frostbite once the threshold is reached.
Vulnerability to damage increases for a certain duration.

Stimulating Boluses.name: Stimulating Boluses
description: Light-purple boluses made from cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates buildup of sleep.
Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of FP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber.
Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

Preserving Boluses.name: Preserving Boluses
Preserving Boluses.summary: Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot
description: Scarlet boluses made of cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot aliment.
Scarlet rot accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Scarlet rot ailment greatly lowers HP in steady increments for a period.

Rejuvenating Boluses.name: Rejuvenating Boluses
description: Black boluses made of cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates death blight buildup.
Blight accumulates slowly, causing instant death once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

Clarifying Boluses.name: Clarifying Boluses
description: Yellow boluses made of cave moss.
Craftable item.
Alleviates madness buildup.
Madness accumulates slowly, inflicting heavy damage and reducing FP once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

Flask of Cerulean Tears.name: Flask of Cerulean Tears
description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing.
Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use.
Rest at a site of grace to replenish.
The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

Flask of Cerulean Tears +1.name: Flask of Cerulean Tears +1
description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing.
Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use.
Rest at a site of grace to replenish.
The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing.

The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

Flask of Cerulean Tears +10.name: Flask of Cerulean Tears +10
description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing.
Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use.
Rest at a site of grace to replenish.
The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

Flask of Cerulean Tears +11.name: Flask of Cerulean Tears +11
description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing.
Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use.
Rest at a site of grace to replenish.
The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

Rest at a site of grace to replenish.
The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

Pickled Turtle Neck.name: Pickled Turtle Neck
description: Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal
solution. Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts stamina recovery.
The nutrients churn through the body, practically boiling out endless power.

Immunizing Cured Meat.name: Immunizing Cured Meat
description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts immunity.
Higher immunity helps to mitigate the buildup of various poisons and scarlet rot.

Invigorating Cured Meat.name: Invigorating Cured Meat
description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts robustness.
Higher robustness helps to mitigate the buildup of frost and blood loss.

Clarifying Cured Meat.name: Clarifying Cured Meat
description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts focus.
Higher focus helps to mitigate the buildup of sleep and madness.

Dappled Cured Meat.name: Dappled Cured Meat
Dappled Cured Meat.summary: Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness and focus
description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.

Spellproof Dried Liver.name: Spellproof Dried Liver
description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a blue medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts magic damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with magic.

Fireproof Dried Liver.name: Fireproof Dried Liver
description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts fire damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with fire.

Lightningproof Dried Liver.name: Lightningproof Dried Liver
description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in an yellow medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts lightning damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with lightning.

Holyproof Dried Liver.name: Holyproof Dried Liver
description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a golden medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts holy damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with holiness.

Silver-Pickled Fowl Foot.name: Silver-Pickled Fowl Foot
description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a silvery medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts item discovery.
Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.

Gold-Pickled Fowl Foot.name: Gold-Pickled Fowl Foot
Gold-Pickled Fowl Foot.summary: Boosts rune acquisition for a time
description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration.
Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.

Exalted Flesh.name: Exalted Flesh
description: A lump of animal flesh pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts physical attack.
Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they deem heroes.

Raw Meat Dumpling.name: Raw Meat Dumpling
Raw Meat Dumpling.summary: Restores HP but also poisons the user
description: A pungent raw meatball, made succulent by virtue of being on the verge of turning.
Restores HP but also poisons the user.
Not recommended for those who prefer to know the origin of their meats.

Starlight Shards.name: Starlight Shards
description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow.
What remains of a passing flash of starlight.
Use to gradually recover FP.
A prized item that was once used in the Eternal City as an ingredient in intoxicating draughts.

Immunizing White Cured Meat.name: Immunizing White Cured Meat
description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts immunity.
Lasts longer than traditional cured meat, but with reduced effectiveness.

Invigorating White Cured Meat.name: Invigorating White Cured Meat
description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts robustness.
Lasts longer than traditional cured meat, but with reduced effectiveness.

Clarifying White Cured Meat.name: Clarifying White Cured Meat
description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts focus.
Lasts longer than traditional cured meat, but with reduced effectiveness.

Dappled White Cured Meat.name: Dappled White Cured Meat
Dappled White Cured Meat.summary: Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness and focus
description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution.
Craftable item.
Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.
Lasts longer than traditional cured meat, but with reduced effectiveness.

Fire Grease.name: Fire Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, adding fire damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Lightning Grease.name: Lightning Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of fulminating materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, adding lightning damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Magic Grease.name: Magic Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, adding magic damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Holy Grease.name: Holy Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of holy resonant materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, adding holy damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Blood Grease.name: Blood Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of blood-red materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, inflicting blood loss.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Soporific Grease.name: Soporific Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of light-purple materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, inflicting sleep.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Poison Grease.name: Poison Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of poison-green materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, inflicting poison.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Freezing Grease.name: Freezing Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of frozen materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, inflicting frost.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Dragonwound Grease.name: Dragonwound Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of Gravel Stones. Craftable item.
Coats armament, granting anti-dragon effects.
The effect lasts only for a short time.
When the dragons were born from their ancient kin, they lost their stone scales, which can now be used to cause them mortal harm.

Rot Grease.name: Rot Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of rotten materials. Craftable item.
Coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

Drawstring Fire Grease.name: Drawstring Fire Grease
Drawstring Fire Grease.summary: Quickly coats armament, inflicting fire damage
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting fire damage, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

Drawstring Lightning Grease.name: Drawstring Lightning Grease
Drawstring Lightning Grease.summary: Quickly coats armament, inflicting lightning damage
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of fulminating materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting lightning damage, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

Drawstring Magic Grease.name: Drawstring Magic Grease
Drawstring Magic Grease.summary: Quickly coats armament, inflicting magic damage
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting magic damage, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

Drawstring Holy Grease.summary: Quickly coats armament, inflicting holy damage
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of holy resonant materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting holy damage, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

Drawstring Blood Grease.name: Drawstring Blood Grease
Drawstring Blood Grease.summary: Quickly coats armament, inflicting blood loss
description: Blistered solid grease made from a mixture of blood-red materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting blood loss, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

Drawstring Soporific Grease.name: Drawstring Soporific Grease
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of light-purple materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting sleep, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of poison-green materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.

Drawstring Rot Grease.summary: Quickly coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of rotten materials. Craftable item.
A short string is attached to this lump.
Quickly coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

Shield Grease.name: Shield Grease
Shield Grease.summary: Boosts guarding ability and all damage negation
description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials. Craftable item.
Coats left-hand armament, boosting guarding ability and all forms of damage negation.
The effect lasts only for a short time.
Primarily used on shields.

Throwing Dagger.name: Throwing Dagger
Throwing Dagger.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict damage
description: Short dagger for throwing. It has no handguard.
The blade is polished, and its weight is expertly balanced.
Throw at enemies to deal damage.
This auxiliary weapon, used primarily to constrain an enemy's movements, can still be deadly in the right hands.

Bone Dart.name: Bone Dart
Bone Dart.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict damage
description: Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing.
Craftable item.
Throw at enemies to inflict damage.

Poisonbone Dart.name: Poisonbone Dart
Poisonbone Dart.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison
description: Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing, with a poison-laced tip.
Craftable item.
Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison.

Kukri.name: Kukri
Kukri.summary: Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss
description: A large knife used for throwing.
Its curved blade is sharp enough to slice flesh cleanly.
Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss.
This heavy throwing weapon is unsuitable for swift attacks, but is able to inflict heavy damage.

Crystal Dart.name: Crystal Dart
Crystal Dart.summary: Uses FP. Throw to inflict magic damage.
description: Throwing knife chiseled from impure crystal.
Craftable item.
Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to deal magic damage.
Long ago, it is said that a golem crafter employed a similar crystal tool.

Fan Daggers.name: Fan Daggers
Fan Daggers.summary: Throw fanned-out knives at enemies to inflict damage
description: A set of five throwing knives bundled together.
A concealed weapon cherished by the raptor assassins.
The thin knives fan out when thrown, dealing damage to the target.
Each knife deals paltry damage, but the wide range makes it suitable for constraining enemies.

Ruin Fragment.name: Ruin Fragment
description: Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky.
Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies.
These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky.
They glow with a faint light from within.

Explosive Stone.name: Explosive Stone
Explosive Stone.summary: Explodes when thrown, inflicting fire damage
description: A small stone with a smoldering core.
Explodes when thrown at enemies, inflicting fire damage.
Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.

Explosive Stone Clump.name: Explosive Stone Clump
Explosive Stone Clump.summary: Explodes when thrown together, inflicting fire damage
description: A clump of small stones with smoldering cores.
Explodes when thrown together at enemies, inflicting fire damage.
Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.

Poisoned Stone.name: Poisoned Stone
Poisoned Stone.summary: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison
description: A small stone with a poison core.
Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.
Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.

Poisoned Stone Clump.name: Poisoned Stone Clump
Poisoned Stone Clump.summary: Throw together to cause buildup of poison
description: A clump of small stones with poison cores.
Throw together at enemies to cause buildup of poison.
Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.

Rainbow Stone.name: Rainbow Stone
Rainbow Stone.summary: Shines with colored light when placed, serving as a guide
description: Ruin Fragment that has undergone some simple processing.
Craftable item.
Stones such as these shine with the colors of the rainbow, making them useful markers when placed on the ground.
Can also be dropped to gauge the distance of a fall. The higher the pitch of the sound, the higher the likelihood of the fall being fatal.
Once used to entertain children on the fringes of the Lands Between.

Glowstone.name: Glowstone
Glowstone.summary: Emits a faint light from the location it is placed
description: Polished Ruin Fragment that shines brighter than Rainbow Stone.
Craftable item.
Emits light from the location it is placed, illuminating surroundings.
However, the effect is short-lived, and it lacks the diverse colors of rainbow stones.
May serve some benefit in dark places, or at night.

Telescope.name: Telescope
Telescope.summary: Allows viewer to see faraway things
description: Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family.
A stolen part of a larger instrument.
Allows the viewer to better see faraway things.
During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine. The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.

Grace Mimic.name: Grace Mimic
Grace Mimic.summary: Light shows the path, but without order
description: A fetish indicating the guidance of grace.
Craftable item.
Similar to grace, this fetish draws rays guiding the way, only without any sense of order.
Useful as a last resort for those who have lost their way, or for use by those who believe that unrefined guidance will lead to truer encounters.

Lantern.name: Lantern
Lantern.summary: Attach to waist to illuminate surroundings
description: A small waist-worn lantern that illuminates surroundings.
Use once to turn on, and again to turn off.
While its light is dimmer than that of a torch,
it has the advantage of freeing up the user's hands.

Blasphemous Claw.name: Blasphemous Claw
Blasphemous Claw.summary: Deflects the power of the Black Blade
description: A slab of rock engraved with traces of the Rune of Death.
Can deflect the power of the Black Blade.

On the night of the dire plot, Ranni rewarded Praetor Rykard with these traces. Should the coming trespass one day transpire, they would serve as a last-resort foil, allowing Rykard to challenge Maliketh the Black Blade, the black beast of Destined Death.

Soft Cotton.name: Soft Cotton
Soft Cotton.summary: Temporarily reduces fall damage/sound and sound of footsteps
description: A soft but sturdy cotton formed from splitting open Rowa fruit in a particular manner.
Craftable item.
Attaching this cotton to the bottom of one's feet allows for a temporary reduction in fall damage and sound. It also reduces the sound of one's footsteps.
If you must court danger, at the very least, tread lightly.

Soap.name: Soap
Soap.summary: Removes filth and accumulations on the body
description: A plant-based soap made from mushroom juice.
Craftable item.
Cleans off filth and other accumulations on the body while also slightly reducing poison buildup.
Filth covering the exterior eventually seeps inside, soiling one's very spirit.

Margit's Shackle.name: Margit's Shackle
Margit's Shackle.summary: Briefly binds Margit, once imprisoned, to earth
description: A fetish bathed in golden magic.
Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement.
Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power—enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.

Mohg's Shackle.name: Mohg's Shackle
Mohg's Shackle.summary: Briefly binds Mohg, once imprisoned, to earth
description: A fetish bathed in golden magic.
Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement.
Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power—enough to trap the once-bound Mohg on earth, if only for a short time.

Pureblood Knight's Medal.name: Pureblood Knight's Medal
Pureblood Knight's Medal.summary: Audience with Mohg will be granted, one day
description: Proof that one is a glorious knight of the new Dynasty of Mohgwyn that the Lord of Blood will inaugurate.
Use to be granted audience with Mohg. Only, it is not yet time.
For Mohg yet slumbers beside the Divinity.
Be patient. The new dynasty is nigh.

Miquella's Needle.name: Miquella's Needle
description: One of the unalloyed gold needles that Miquella crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods.
Capable of subduing the flame of frenzy if inherited, allowing one to cheat fate and avoid becoming Lord of Frenzied Flame.
However, the needle is as yet unfinished and can only be used in the heart of the storm beyond time said to be found in Farum Azula.

Prattling Pate \"Hello\".name: Prattling Pate "Hello"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
Emits a voice that says "Hello."
A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.

Prattling Pate \"Thank you\".name: Prattling Pate "Thank you"
Prattling Pate \"Thank you\".summary: Emits a voice that says "Thank you"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
Emits a voice that says "Thank you."
A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.

description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.

Prattling Pate \"Wonderful\".name: Prattling Pate "Wonderful"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.

Prattling Pate \"Please help\".name: Prattling Pate "Please help"
Prattling Pate \"Please help\".summary: Emits a voice that says "Please help"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.

Prattling Pate \"My beloved\".name: Prattling Pate "My beloved"
Prattling Pate \"My beloved\".summary: Emits a voice that says "My beloved"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
Emits a voice that says "My beloved."
A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.
Expressions of love are among the most fickle.

Prattling Pate \"Let's get to it\".name: Prattling Pate "Let's get to it"
Prattling Pate \"Let's get to it\".summary: Emits a voice that says "Let's get to it"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
Emits a voice that says "Let's get to it."
A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.

Prattling Pate \"You're beautiful\".name: Prattling Pate "You're beautiful"
Prattling Pate \"You're beautiful\".summary: Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a demi-human head.
Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful."
A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.
Unconditional love. Unrestrained assurance.
It must have been a mother speaking.

Golden Rune [1].name: Golden Rune [1]
Golden Rune [1].summary: Use to gain a small number of runes
description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering trace of gold.
Use to gain 200 runes.
Runes are nourishment for the development of any Tarnished. Provided a Finger Maiden can be found...

Numen's Rune.summary: Use to gain a multitude of runes
description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.
Use to gain 12500 runes.
The Numen are said to have come from outside the Lands Between, and are in fact of the same stock as Queen Marika herself.

Hero's Rune [1].name: Hero's Rune [1]
Hero's Rune [1].summary: Use to gain an abundance of runes
description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.
Use to gain 15000 runes.
There were once heroes who walked the battlefields, abundantly blessed by the Erdtree itself, who upon earning their honor simply died.

Hero's Rune [2].name: Hero's Rune [2]
Hero's Rune [2].summary: Use to gain an abundance of runes
description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.

description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.

Lord's Rune.name: Lord's Rune
Lord's Rune.summary: Use to gain an enormous abundance of runes
description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; true vestiges of gold.
Use to gain 50000 runes.
Runes of one who was destined to become a Lord, but when the Elden Ring was shattered, all that remained was a distant duty.

Remembrance of the Grafted.name: Remembrance of the Grafted
Remembrance of the Grafted.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Godrick, the Grafted, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
A feeble man sought power through the grotesque act of grafting. "One day we'll return together, to our home, bathed in rays of gold."

Remembrance of the Starscourge.name: Remembrance of the Starscourge
Remembrance of the Starscourge.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Starscourge Radahn, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
The Red Lion General wielded gravitational powers which he learned in Sellia during his younger days. All so he would never have to abandon his beloved but scrawny steed.

Remembrance of the Omen King.name: Remembrance of the Omen King
Remembrance of the Omen King.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Morgott, the Omen King, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
Though born one of the graceless Omen, Morgott took it upon himself to become the Erdtree's protector. He loved not in return, for he was never loved, but nevertheless, love it he did.

Remembrance of the Blasphemous.name: Remembrance of the Blasphemous
Remembrance of the Blasphemous.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
Rykard took the form of a giant serpent that he might devour, grow, and live eternally. "I understand. The road of blasphemy is long and perilous. One cannot walk it unprepared to sin."

Remembrance of the Rot Goddess.name: Remembrance of the Rot Goddess
Remembrance of the Rot Goddess.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Malenia, Goddess of Rot, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.

Miquella and Malenia are both the children of a single god. As such they are both Empyreans, but suffered afflictions from birth. One was cursed with eternal childhood, and the other harbored rot within.

Remembrance of the Blood Lord.name: Remembrance of the Blood Lord
Remembrance of the Blood Lord.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Mohg, Lord of Blood, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.

Wishing to raise Miquella to full godhood, Mohg wished to become his consort, taking the role of monarch. But no matter how much of his bloody bedchamber he tried to share, he received no response from the young Empyrean.

Remembrance of the Black Blade.name: Remembrance of the Black Blade
Remembrance of the Black Blade.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
Maliketh was a shadowbound beast given to his Empyrean. Marika's sole need of her shadow was a vessel to lock away Destined Death. Even then, she betrayed him.

Remembrance of Hoarah Loux.name: Remembrance of Hoarah Loux
Remembrance of Hoarah Loux.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of the warrior Hoarah Loux, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
When Godfrey, first Elden Lord was robbed of his grace, becoming Tarnished, he took with him his kinfolk and left the Lands Between.
After the Long March of the Tarnished came to an end, Godfrey divested himself of kingship, becoming a simple warrior once more.

Remembrance of the Dragonlord.name: Remembrance of the Dragonlord
Remembrance of the Dragonlord.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
The Dragonlord whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time is said to have been Elden Lord in the age before the Erdtree. Once his god was fled, the lord continued to await its return.

Remembrance of the Full Moon Queen.name: Remembrance of the Full Moon Queen
Remembrance of the Full Moon Queen.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
In her youth, Rennala was a prominent champion who charmed the academy with her lunar magic, becoming its master. She also led the Glintstone Knights and established the house of Caria as royalty.

Remembrance of the Lichdragon.name: Remembrance of the Lichdragon
Remembrance of the Lichdragon.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Lichdragon Fortissax, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.

After Godwyn the Golden became the Prince of Death, the ancient dragon fought long and hard against the Death within its companion. Alas, victory was never achieved and its only reward was corruption.

Remembrance of the Fire Giant.name: Remembrance of the Fire Giant
Remembrance of the Fire Giant.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Fire Giant, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.

The Fire Giant is a survivor of the War against the Giants. Upon realizing the flames of their forge would never die, Queen Marika marked him with a curse. "O trifling giant, mayest thou tend thy flame for eternity."

Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor.name: Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor
Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor Spirit, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
Ancestral spirits exist as a phenomenon beyond the purview of the Erdtree. Life sprouts from death, as it does from birth. Such is the way of the living.

Elden Remembrance.name: Elden Remembrance
Elden Remembrance.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of the Elden Beast, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
It was the vassal beast of the Greater Will and living incarnation of the concept of Order.

Remembrance of the Naturalborn.name: Remembrance of the Naturalborn
Remembrance of the Naturalborn.summary: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader
description: Remembrance of Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, hewn into the Erdtree.
The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader.
Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
A malformed star born in the lightless void far away. Once destroyed an Eternal City and took away their sky. A falling star of ill omen.

Lands Between Rune.name: Lands Between Rune
description: Grace said to have once dwelled in the eyes of the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.
Use to gain 3000 runes.
No grace resides in the eyes of the Tarnished; if it ever did, it is now lost.

Ancestral Infant's Head.name: Ancestral Infant's Head
Ancestral Infant's Head.summary: Uses FP to spray spirit vapor
description: Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear.
Uses FP to spray spirit vapor inflicting magic damage.
The vapor becomes a temporary geyser which deals continuous damage to everything it touches until it disappears.

Omen Bairn.name: Omen Bairn
Omen Bairn.summary: Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes
description: Doll of a curseborn bairn.
Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes.
Omen babies have all their horns excised, causing most to perish. These fetishes are made to memorialize them.
"Please, don't hate me, or curse me. Please."

Regal Omen Bairn.name: Regal Omen Bairn
Regal Omen Bairn.summary: Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes
description: Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line.
Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes.
Omen babies born of royalty do not have their horns excised, but instead are kept underground, unbeknownst to anyone, imprisoned for eternity.
These memorial fetishes are fashioned in secret.

Miranda's Prayer.name: Miranda's Prayer
Miranda's Prayer.summary: Uses FP to call down a deluge of light
description: This statuette depicts a flower that preys on humans, posed in prayer.
Uses FP to call down a deluge of light.
Miranda, maiden of the Flower Crucible is said to have been the very first of this breed.

Cuckoo Glintstone.name: Cuckoo Glintstone
Cuckoo Glintstone.summary: Uses FP to produce a magic bolt
description: Lump of broken glintstone enwreathed with magic power. A "faux sorcery" used by the Knights of the Cuckoo. Craftable item.
Launched straight ahead, using FP. A magic bolt springs forth from the point of impact.

Mimic's Veil.name: Mimic's Veil
Mimic's Veil.summary: Uses FP to mimic nearby objects
description: Golden veil of intricate design.
Uses FP to mimic nearby objects.
When Godrick was hounded from Leyndell, the Royal Capital, this was one of a multitude of treasures he took with him. Also known as "Marika's Mischief."

Glintstone Scrap.name: Glintstone Scrap
Glintstone Scrap.summary: Break gem and use FP to produce a magic bolt
description: Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels.
Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt.
Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.

Large Glintstone Scrap.name: Large Glintstone Scrap
Large Glintstone Scrap.summary: Break gem and use FP to produce many magic bolts
description: Large piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels.
Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt.
Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.

Gravity Stone Fan.name: Gravity Stone Fan
Gravity Stone Fan.summary: Uses FP to emit fan-shaped gravitational shockwave
description: Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike.
It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic.
Uses FP to emit gravitational shockwave.
The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."

Gravity Stone Chunk.name: Gravity Stone Chunk
Gravity Stone Chunk.summary: Uses FP to cause a gravitational explosion
description: Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike.
It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic.
Throw at enemies, using FP to cause a gravitational explosion.
The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."

Wraith Calling Bell.name: Wraith Calling Bell
Wraith Calling Bell.summary: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths
description: Bell used by worshippers of revenants.
Ring bell, using FP to summon prowling wraiths. This can be done multiple times in a row.
Wraiths are said to be the vengeful spirits of those who died when cursed.

Warming Stone.name: Warming Stone
Warming Stone.summary: Uses FP to continuously heal nearby allies
description: Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers. Craftable item.
Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those nearby.
It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.

Frenzyflame Stone.name: Frenzyflame Stone
Frenzyflame Stone.summary: Uses FP to continuously heal chaos followers
description: Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Three Fingers. Craftable item.
Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those who host the frenzied flame.
Confers madness upon those who have not adopted the flame. Take care not to mistake this for its gentler cousin.

Scriptstone.name: Scriptstone
Scriptstone.summary: Reveals more messages from other worlds
description: Ruin Fragment with a cipher inscription.
Craftable item.
Uses FP to reveal more messages from other worlds.
Words are gregarious things, drawn to one another much as people are.

Bewitching Branch.name: Bewitching Branch
Bewitching Branch.summary: Uses FP to charm pierced enemy
description: Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold.
Craftable item.
Pierce a foe, using FP to turn them into a temporary ally.
The Empyrean Miquella is loved by many people. Indeed, he has learned very well how to compel such affection.

Baldachin's Blessing.name: Baldachin's Blessing
Baldachin's Blessing.summary: Uses FP to temporarily boost poise
description: Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber.
Uses FP to temporarily boost poise.
The favor allows one to forget any aches and pains. In Death, there is only peace, for in Death, there can be no sensation.

conditions: Damage Level Change before Poise Break

Radiant Baldachin's Blessing.name: Radiant Baldachin's Blessing
Radiant Baldachin's Blessing.summary: Uses FP to temporarily boost poise
description: Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity.
Uses FP to temporarily raise poise.
The effect lasts longer than a mere favor.
It is said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.

conditions: Damage Level Change before Poise Break

Uplifting Aromatic.name: Uplifting Aromatic
Uplifting Aromatic.summary: Boosts ally attack power and reduces incoming damage once
description: Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering.
Craftable with a perfume bottle.
Uses FP to raise the attack power of the user and nearby allies while also reducing the damage from one incoming attack by half.
This aromatic has an extremely potent morale-raising effect that makes those accustomed to it fearless in the face of death. It was this influence that made the perfumers exceptional commanders.

Spark Aromatic.name: Spark Aromatic
Spark Aromatic.summary: Uses FP to scatter sparks in a wide area
description: Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering.
Craftable with a perfume bottle.
Uses FP to broadly scatter sparks in a wide arc straight ahead.
Though fire was prohibited to those who served the Erdtree, this rule was forgotten as the war drew ever on.

Ironjar Aromatic.name: Ironjar Aromatic
Ironjar Aromatic.summary: Uses FP to temporarily turn wielder's body to steel
description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
Craftable with a perfume bottle.
Uses FP to temporarily turn body to steel, boosting poise, resistances and damage negation at the expense of mobility and lightning resistance.
An art that requires fragments of hunted noble jars. Depraved perfumers are plainly in league with jar poachers.

Bloodboil Aromatic.name: Bloodboil Aromatic
Bloodboil Aromatic.summary: Uses FP to enter a temporary state of fervor
description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
Craftable with a perfume bottle.
Uses FP to enter a temporary state of fervor, raising maximum attack power and stamina while also increasing damage received.
"Even upon the battlefield, do you fear being wounded? Take a good look. Your limbs are frozen stiff."

Poison Spraymist.name: Poison Spraymist
Poison Spraymist.summary: Uses FP to release poison mist from the mouth
description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
Craftable with a perfume bottle.
Uses FP to release a poison mist from user's mouth, causing a buildup of poison.
Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.

Acid Spraymist.name: Acid Spraymist
Acid Spraymist.summary: Uses FP to release acid mist from the mouth
description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
Craftable with a perfume bottle.
Uses FP to release an acidic mist from user's mouth, damaging armaments and temporarily lowering attack power.
Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.

Glass Shard.name: Glass Shard
Glass Shard.summary: Shard of filthy glass. Worthless rubbish.
description: Glass shard covered in dirt.
Because it sparkles in the light, it might be mistaken for an object of value when seen from afar.
It cannot produce light by itself. Essentially worthless.

Crimsonspill Crystal Tear.name: Crimsonspill Crystal Tear
Crimsonspill Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts max HP in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum HP.

Greenspill Crystal Tear.name: Greenspill Crystal Tear
Greenspill Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts stamina in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum stamina.

Crimson Crystal Tear.name: Crimson Crystal Tear
Crimson Crystal Tear.summary: Restores half of total HP in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum HP.

Cerulean Crystal Tear.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
Cerulean Crystal Tear.summary: Restores half of total FP in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum FP.

Speckled Hardtear.name: Speckled Hardtear
Speckled Hardtear.summary: Boosts resistance and heals status in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.

Crimson Bubbletear.name: Crimson Bubbletear
Crimson Bubbletear.summary: Restores HP when near death in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction automatically heals one's HP in the moment before death.
However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.

Opaline Bubbletear.name: Opaline Bubbletear
Opaline Bubbletear.summary: Significantly negates damage in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
Provides significant damage negation.
However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.

Crimsonburst Crystal Tear.name: Crimsonburst Crystal Tear
Crimsonburst Crystal Tear.summary: Steadily restores HP for a time in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction gradually restores one's HP over time.

Greenburst Crystal Tear.name: Greenburst Crystal Tear
Greenburst Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed.

Opaline Hardtear.name: Opaline Hardtear
Opaline Hardtear.summary: Temporarily boosts all damage negation in physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.

Winged Crystal Tear.name: Winged Crystal Tear
Winged Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily reduces equip load in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
Temporarily reduces equipment load.

Thorny Cracked Tear.name: Thorny Cracked Tear
Thorny Cracked Tear.summary: Makes consecutive attacks grow stronger in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

Spiked Cracked Tear.name: Spiked Cracked Tear
Spiked Cracked Tear.summary: Enhances charged attacks for a time in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction increases the power of charged attacks for a certain duration.

Windy Crystal Tear.name: Windy Crystal Tear
Windy Crystal Tear.summary: Enhances dodge rolls for a time in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction increases the effectiveness of dodge rolls for a certain duration. However, damage taken is also increased during the concoction's effect.

Ruptured Crystal Tear.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
Ruptured Crystal Tear.summary: Causes concoction to explode in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
Causes the resulting concoction to explode.
A defective crystal tear which possesses absolutely no medicinal qualities. A lesson said to be learned the hard way for some; faith can be a volatile matter, after all.

Leaden Hardtear.name: Leaden Hardtear
Leaden Hardtear.summary: Temporarily boosts poise in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's poise.

Twiggy Cracked Tear.name: Twiggy Cracked Tear
Twiggy Cracked Tear.summary: Briefly stop rune loss on death in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction prevents one's runes from being lost upon death. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear.name: Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear
Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear.summary: Converts damage received into HP in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction converts incoming damage into recovered HP instead. However, physical damage cannot be converted.
This effect is only brief and will quickly expire.

Strength-knot Crystal Tear.name: Strength-knot Crystal Tear
Strength-knot Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts strength in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's strength.

Dexterity-knot Crystal Tear.name: Dexterity-knot Crystal Tear
Dexterity-knot Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts dexterity in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's dexterity.

Intelligence-knot Crystal Tear.name: Intelligence-knot Crystal Tear
Intelligence-knot Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts intelligence in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's intelligence.

Faith-knot Crystal Tear.name: Faith-knot Crystal Tear
Faith-knot Crystal Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts faith in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's faith.

Cerulean Hidden Tear.name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
Cerulean Hidden Tear.summary: Eliminates all FP consumption in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction eliminates all FP consumption.
However, this effect is only brief and will quickly expire.

Stonebarb Cracked Tear.name: Stonebarb Cracked Tear
Stonebarb Cracked Tear.summary: Makes attacks more likely to break enemy stances in a mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction makes one's attacks more likely to break enemy stances. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

Purifying Crystal Tear.name: Purifying Crystal Tear
Purifying Crystal Tear.summary: Purifies the Lord of Blood's curse in a mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction purifies the curse from Mohg, Lord of Blood's terrifying rite of blood.

Flame-Shrouding Cracked Tear.name: Flame-Shrouding Cracked Tear
Flame-Shrouding Cracked Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts fire attacks in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.

Magic-Shrouding Cracked Tear.name: Magic-Shrouding Cracked Tear
Magic-Shrouding Cracked Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts magic attacks in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's magic attacks.

Lightning-Shrouding Cracked Tear.name: Lightning-Shrouding Cracked Tear
Lightning-Shrouding Cracked Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts lightning attacks in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's lightning attacks.

Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear.name: Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear
Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear.summary: Temporarily boosts holy attacks in mixed physick
description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's holy attacks.
